comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
I think Mr Hall, the photographer,  was possibly on Fort Denison / Pinchgut for this photo.  Also for the 'Fairlight' photo.  Interesting to compare the photos - this one is later due to the 1893 sheerlegs ...

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8163057702/in/photostream]

comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] I DONT KNOW. Fabulous name for a boat don't you think :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Yes, that's great!   Aussie larrikin humour.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I have an alternative name for the boat: The THERE ARE KNOWN KNOWNS; THERE ARE THINGS WE KNOW THAT WE KNOW. THERE ARE KNOWN UNKNOWNS; THAT IS TO SAY THERE ARE THINGS THAT, WE NOW KNOW WE DON'T KNOW. BUT THERE ARE ALSO UNKNOWN UNKNOWN - THERE ARE THINGS WE DO NOT KNOW WE DON'T KNOW, or more simply, The RUMSFELD. :)

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Ha!  You would need an American aircraft carrier to fit that name on the stern.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Both excellent suggestions! Would love to see an aircraft carrier poking around the edge of this image - perhaps a bit early :)
